content.title: Pradhan Mantri Jeevan Jyoti Bima Yojana
content.details: Pradhan Mantri Jeevan Jyoti Bima Yojana (PMJJBY) is an insurance scheme offering life insurance cover for death due to any reason. It is a one-year cover, renewable from year to year. The scheme is offered by banks/post offices and administered through life insurance companies. All individuals who are account holders of participating banks/post offices in the age group of 18 to 50 years are entitled to join.
benefits: One-year term life cover of ₹ 2.00 Lakh to all the subscribers in the age group of 18-50 years.
Covers death due to any reason.
Premium payable is ₹ 436/- per annum per subscriber, to be auto debited from the subscriber’s bank/post office account.
eligibility: The age of the applicant must be between 18 to 50 Years.
The applicant must hold an individual bank/post office account.

faqs.question: How do I pay the premium for PMJJBY?
faqs.answer: The premium will be deducted from the account holder’s bank/Post office account through ‘auto debit’ facility.

faqs.question: What is the validity of the insurance cover in PMJJBY?
faqs.answer: Coverage under PMJJBY is valid for one year from 1st June to 31st May on payment of annual premium.

faqs.question: Is delayed enrolment for prospective cover possible under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes. Delayed enrolment for prospective cover is possible on payment of premium as described below – a) For enrolment in June, July and August – Full Annual Premium of Rs.436/- is payable. b) For enrolment in September, October, and November –premium of Rs. 342/- is payable c) For enrolment in December, January and February –premium of Rs. 228/- is payable. d) For enrolment in March, April and May –premium of Rs. 114/- is payable.

faqs.question: If I decide to exit the scheme, is there any possibility that I can rejoin at a later point of time?
faqs.answer: Yes. One can enroll again under the same conditions of eligibility stipulated in the Scheme.

faqs.question: Who will offer/administer the scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme would be offered/administered through Insurance companies willing to offer the product with necessary approvals on similar terms, in collaboration with participating Banks.

faqs.question: What is the minimum eligibility to subscribe to PMJJBY?
faqs.answer: All savings bank account holders in the age 18 to 50 years in participating banks will be entitled to join.

faqs.question: Are NRIs eligible for coverage under PMJJBY?
faqs.answer: Any NRI having an eligible bank account with a bank branch located in India is eligible for purchase of PMJJBY cover subject to fulfilment of the terms and conditions relating to the scheme.

faqs.question: Does the PMJJBY cover death resulting from natural calamities such as earthquake, flood and other convulsions of nature?
faqs.answer: Yes, all these events are covered under PMJJBY.

faqs.question: How do I access the Claim Form for PMJJBY?
faqs.answer: The claim forms can be accessed from the link - https://www.jansuraksha.gov.in/Files/PMJJBY/English/ClaimForm.pdf
